p: The pandemic 2019 Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) caused by Severe Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) coronavirus (CoV) type 2 (SARS-CoV-2) ( WHO, 2020) prompted the research on therapy and immune-prophylaxis, taking advantage of previous knowledge accumulated on SARS-CoV-1 and animal CoVs ( Decaro et al., 2020). To date, no specific drug has been approved for the treatment of patients with COVID-19. However, remdesivir, an inhibitor of RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp), demonstrated promising results ( Kabir et al., 2020). Moreover, studies to evaluate the efficacy of teicoplanin and monoclonal and polyclonal antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 are currently ongoing ( Kabir et al., 2020).
